Description.DescriptionSummary: Calls the contact passed in as input using FaceTime.
Creates a note using the content passed as input.
Calls the phone number passed in as input.

Description.DescriptionInput: The destination
Description.DescriptionResult: The shareable link to your Uber ride
Description.DescriptionSummary: Requests an Uber from the specified location to the location passed as input.

RequiredResources.WFUnavailableResourceReason: Shortcuts is no longer able to support Uber.

Description.DescriptionInput: An existing animated GIF, if desired.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds an image to the existing animated GIF passed as input. If no GIF is passed as input, a new animated GIF is created.

Description.DescriptionInput: Items in your music library or items from the Search iTunes action.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds the music passed as input to your Up Next queue.
Creates a new event and adds it to the selected calendar.

Parameters.Description: The title of this event.
Parameters.Label: Title

Parameters.Description: The calendar to add this event to.
Parameters.Label: Calendar

Parameters.Description: Text representing the date this event begins. Examples: “tomorrow at 2”, “January 3”, “8:00pm”
Parameters.Label: Start Date

Parameters.Description: Text representing the date this event finishes.
Parameters.Label: End Date

Parameters.Description: When enabled, the event takes place over an entire day and time is ignored.
Parameters.Label: All Day

Parameters.Description: Optionally, when to show an alert to notify me of this event.
Parameters.Label: Alert

Parameters.Description: Text representing the date when the alert should occur. Examples: “tonight at 7”, “March 7”
Parameters.Label: Alert Time

Parameters.Description: Optionally, a description for this event.
Parameters.Label: Notes

Description.DescriptionSummary: Creates a new reminder and adds it to the selected list of reminders.

Parameters.Description: The title of this reminder.
Parameters.Label: Title

Parameters.Description: The list of reminders to add this reminder to.
Parameters.Label: List

Parameters.Description: Optionally, where or when to show an alert to notify me of this reminder.
Parameters.Label: Remind Me

Parameters.Description: The distance (in meters) from the provided location to consider “entering” or “leaving” the location.
Parameters.Label: Radius

Parameters.Description: Text representing the address or coordinates of the location that triggers the alert.
Parameters.Label: Of Location
Parameters.Placeholder: One Apple Park Way, Cupertino, CA

Parameters.Description: Text representing the date when the alert should occur. Examples: “tonight at 7”, “March 7”
Parameters.Label: Alert Time

Parameters.Description: Optionally, a description for this reminder.
Parameters.Label: Notes

Description.DescriptionSummary: Passes the specified address to the next action.

Description.DescriptionInput: Items in your music library or items from the Search iTunes action.
Description.DescriptionResult: The contents of the updated playlist
Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds the items passed as input to the specified playlist.

Description.DescriptionNote: This action supports decimal numbers when adding or subtracting seconds, minutes, hours, or days. Otherwise only integers are supported.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds or subtracts an amount of time from the date passed into the action.
Prompts to share the input via AirDrop.
Sets the device’s Airplane Mode to on or off.
Creates an alarm in the Clock app.
Enables or disables an alarm in the Clock app.
Displays an alert with a title, a message, and two buttons. If the user selects the OK button, the shortcut continues. The cancel button stops the shortcut.
Appends the text passed as input to the specified note.

Parameters.Description: The note to append to
Parameters.Label: Note

Description.DescriptionResult: The updated contents of the variable.
Description.DescriptionSummary:
Appends this action's input to the specified variable, creating the variable if it does not exist.

This allows you to make a variable hold multiple items.
Displays a dialog prompting the user to enter a piece of information.

Parameters.Description: When enabled and run on Apple Watch, this action immediately begins listening for voice input.
Parameters.Label: Skip to Watch Dictation

Description.DescriptionSummary: Edits an image or PDF with Markup.
Encodes or decodes text or files using Base64 encoding.
Sets the device’s Bluetooth to on or off.
Sets the device’s Cellular Data to on or off.
Presents a menu of the items passed as input to the action and outputs the user's selection.

Parameters.Description: The instruction provided when the list is presented.
Parameters.Label: Prompt

Parameters.Description: When enabled, multiple items may be chosen from the list.
Parameters.Label: Select Multiple

Parameters.Description: When enabled, all of the items in the list will start out selected when Choose from List is presented.
Parameters.Label: Select All Initially

Description.DescriptionSummary: Presents a menu and runs different actions based on which menu item was chosen.

Parameters.Description: The instruction provided when the menu is presented.
Parameters.Label: Prompt

Description.DescriptionSummary: Clears all the music in your Up Next queue.
Uploads the input to CloudApp and returns the CloudApp URL.
This action lets you explain how part of a shortcut works. When run, this action does nothing.
Tests if any item passed as input matches the specified condition, and if so, runs the actions inside. Otherwise, the actions under “Otherwise” are run.
Passes the specified contacts to the next action.
Autocorrects the spelling of text passed into the action.

Description.DescriptionNote: This is just like the Count in Sesame Street, but instead of a vampire, it's a Shortcuts action.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Counts the number of items, characters, words, sentences, or lines passed as input.

Description.DescriptionInput: Items in your music library or items from the Search iTunes action.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Creates a new playlist in the Music app, adding any items passed as input to the new playlist.
Passes the specified date and time to the next action.
Waits for the specified number of seconds before continuing with the next action.
Deletes the photos passed as input from the device's photo library. This action asks for confirmation before performing the deletion.
Sends the input to another device via DeskConnect. DeskConnect makes it easy to send webpages, documents, pictures, and anything else between your devices.
Returns any street addresses found in the output from the previous action.
Gets contacts from the result of the previous action.
Returns any dates found in the output from the previous action.
Makes a dictionary from the text passed as input. JSON (like {"foo": "bar"}), key-value pairs (like foo=bar&baz=biz), and XML-based plist are supported.
Returns any email addresses found in the output from the previous action.

Gets images from the result of the previous action.

For example, this action can get the album art of a song, or all the images on a webpage.
Returns any links found in the output from the previous action.
Returns numbers from the previous action's output.
Returns any phone numbers found in the output from the previous action.

Returns text from the previous action's output.

For example, this action can get the name of a photo or song, or the text of a webpage.

Description.DescriptionNote: Powered by Microsoft Cognitive Services (microsoft.com/cognitive-services)
Description.DescriptionSummary: Detects the language of the text provided as input.
Transcribes what you say aloud into text and passes the result to the next action.

Description.DescriptionNote: When coerced to text, the dictionary is represented as JSON.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Passes the specified list of key-value pairs to the next action as a dictionary.
Sets the device’s Do Not Disturb to on or off

Parameters.Description: The event after which to turn off Do Not Disturb
Parameters.Label: Event

Parameters.Description: The time after which to turn off Do Not Disturb
Parameters.Label: Time

Description.DescriptionNote: In the iCloud picker, tap “Locations” to see document pickers from other apps.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Get files from iCloud Drive or Dropbox. Turn off “Show Document Picker” to specify a path to retrieve.

Parameters.Description: The path to retrieve, such as "/folder/file.txt"
Parameters.Label: File Path

Description.DescriptionNote: In the iCloud picker, tap “Locations” to see document pickers from other apps.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Save files to iCloud Drive or Dropbox. Turn off “Ask Where to Save” in order to specify a destination path.

Parameters.Description: The path to save to, such as "/folder/file.txt"
Parameters.Label: Destination Path

Description.DescriptionNote: To make a multipart HTTP request, choose "Form" as the request body type and add files as field values.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets the contents of URLs passed into the action. Useful for downloading files and web content, or for making API requests.

Parameters.Description: The HTTP method to use.
Parameters.Label: Method

Description.DescriptionSummary: Passes the specified email addresses to the next action.
Re-encodes the media passed as input at the specified size, optionally converting to audio.

Parameters.Description: A number greater than zero that indicates how fast or slow to encode the media. Values between 0.0 and 1.0 slow down the media.
Parameters.Label: Custom Speed

Description.DescriptionInput: The content to add to your note
Description.DescriptionSummary: Finds a note using the specified criteria and appends the input to the note.

Parameters.Description: The title (or part of the title) of the note to append to
Parameters.Label: Note Title

Parameters.Description: The notebook in which the note is located (optional)
Parameters.Label: In Notebook

Description.DescriptionSummary: Deletes the notes passed as input from Evernote.

Parameters.Description: When enabled, this action will confirm with you before deleting notes from Evernote. You'll always be asked for confirmation when deleting 10 notes or more at a time.
Parameters.Label: Confirm Before Deleting

Description.DescriptionSummary: Get recent notes from Evernote, optionally filtering based on criteria.

Parameters.Description: Text to look for in the title of notes.
Parameters.Label: Title Search

Parameters.Description: A list of tags with which to find matching notes. Wildcard characters (*) may be used.
Parameters.Label: Tags

Parameters.Description: The notebook in which to look for notes (optional)
Parameters.Label: In Notebook

Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets a link to the Evernote note passed into the action, which can be shared.

Parameters.Description: When enabled, an evernote:// URL will be generated, suitable for opening the note in the Evernote app.
Parameters.Label: In-App Link

Description.DescriptionInput: The content to include in your new note
Description.DescriptionSummary: Saves the input as a note in Evernote.

Parameters.Description: The notebook in which to save your new note (optional)
Parameters.Label: Notebook

Parameters.Description: A list of tags to apply to the new note (optional)
Parameters.Label: Tags

Description.DescriptionSummary: Stops execution of the current shortcut and dismisses the shortcut on screen. No more actions will be run after this action.
Prompts to select music from your local music library.
Sends the input via Facebook Messenger

Description.DescriptionNote: If no file exists yet at the specified path, a new file will be created. Make sure to include a file extension (usually .txt) at the end of your path.
Description.DescriptionResult: The file that was appended to
Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds the text passed as input to the end of the specified file.

Parameters.Description: The name or path of the file to retrieve. For example, if you are appending a file called “notes.txt” in a folder called “Public”, use “/Public/notes.txt”.
Parameters.Label: File Path

Description.DescriptionSummary: Makes a new folder in the specified file storage service.

Parameters.Description: The path of the new folder. For example, if you want create “Adventure” in an existing folder titled “Photos”, put “/Photos/Adventure/”
Parameters.Label: Path

Description.DescriptionSummary: Delete the files passed in as input.

Parameters.Description: When enabled, this action will confirm with you before deleting the file.
Parameters.Label: Confirm Before Deleting

Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets a public link to the file passed into the action.

Description.DescriptionNote: If you only see some but not all of your data in the results, make sure that “Allow Shortcuts to read data” is set to on in the Health app.

Description.DescriptionSummary: Turns on or off the flashlight near the device's camera.

Description.DescriptionNote: Custom format strings use the format patterns from Unicode Technical Standard #35 (unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-31/tr35-dates.html#Date_Format_Patterns).
Description.DescriptionSummary: Formats a date and time into text.

Description.DescriptionInput: A file size from another action, or a number of bytes
Description.DescriptionNote: 1000 bytes are shown as 1 KB.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Formats a file size into text.
Formats a number into text.
Generates a QR code from the input text.
Gets every song in the specified playlist.

Description.DescriptionNote:
Use a Get Details of Diffbot Article action immediately after this action to get specific details about the article. This action only supports getting one article from each URL.

Powered by Diffbot (diffbot.com)
Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets article details, including body text, author, publish date, and more, from every URL passed into the action.
Outputs the percentage of battery remaining as a number from 0 to 100.
Returns a particular object class from the input.
Passes the contents of the clipboard to the next action.
Gets the current location of the device.
Returns the song that is currently playing in the Music app, if any.
Gets information about the current device.

Description.DescriptionInput: The destination address
Description.DescriptionSummary: Open directions to the location passed into this action in your choice of Maps, Google Maps, Citymapper, Transit, or Waze. For example, you can use this action to get directions to an upcoming event on your calendar.

Description.DescriptionInput: The destination
Description.DescriptionResult: The distance to the location in miles or kilometers.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Calculates the distance to the location passed into this action.

Description.DescriptionInput: An animated GIF or photo burst
Description.DescriptionSummary: Splits an animated GIF or a photo burst into individual frames.
Gets the halfway point between two locations.
Converts the rich text passed as input to HTML text.

Parameters.Description: This indicates whether or not this action writes out an entire HTML document. If this is turned off, partial HTML will be returned if possible.
Parameters.Label: Make Full Document

Description.DescriptionSummary: Returns the local or external IP address of the device.

Description.DescriptionNote: Lists are one-indexed, so the first item is at index 1, the second is at index 2, etc.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Returns one or more items from the list passed as input. You can get the first item, the last item, a random item, the item at a particular index, or items in a range of indexes.
Returns the name of every item passed as input. Depending on the input, this could be a file name, the title of a website, the title of a calendar event, etc.
Returns the type of every item passed as input. For example, if a URL is passed, this action will return “URL”.
Gets the most recent photos from the camera roll.
Gets the most recent screenshots from the camera roll.
Gets the most recent videos from the camera roll.
Gets the most recent burst photos from the camera roll.
Gets the most recent Live Photos from the camera roll.
Gets the most recent photo import from the Photos app.
Creates a URL to search for the location, place, or text that was passed into the action in a separate maps app.
Converts the rich text passed as input to Markdown text (comparable to Aaron Swartz's html2text script).
Gets the shortcuts stored on this device. For example, you could use this action with the Make Archive action to zip up your shortcuts.
Gets the names of emoji passed into the action.

Description.DescriptionInput: HTML
Description.DescriptionSummary: Takes the inputted HTML and turns it into rich text, which can then be converted to other formats.

Description.DescriptionInput: Markdown
Description.DescriptionSummary: Takes the inputted Markdown and turns it into rich text, which can then be converted to other formats.
Passes the specified text to the next action.

Description.DescriptionNote: This action outputs a negative number if the input date takes place before the specified date.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Subtracts the specified date from the date passed into the action. For example, this action could get the number of minutes from now until a calendar event passed in as input.

Description.DescriptionInput: The destination
Description.DescriptionNote: Travel times are provided by Apple Maps and take into account current traffic conditions.
Description.DescriptionResult: The amount of time it will take to get to the destination. If passed into an action expecting a date, this will be the date and time of arrival if you leave now.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Estimates the amount of time it will take to travel to the location passed into this action.
Returns a particular file type from the input.
Gets upcoming calendar events, ordered from nearest to farthest away in time.
Gets upcoming reminders, ordered from nearest to farthest away due date.

Description.DescriptionNote: URLs are structured as follows: scheme://user:password@host:port/path?query#fragment
Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets the specified part of the URL passed into the action.

Description.DescriptionNote: You can reference values deep inside of a dictionary by providing multiple keys separated by dots. For example, to get the value "soup" from the dictionary {"beverages": [{"favorite": "soup"}]}, you can specify the key path "beverages.1.favorite".
Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets the value for the specified key in the dictionary passed into the action.
Gets the value of the specified variable and passes it to the next action.
Extracts the contents of the webpages passed into the action.
Gets information about the currently connected networks.

Description.DescriptionNote: Powered by Giphy (giphy.com)
Description.DescriptionSummary: Searches for GIFs representing the text specified using Giphy.
Opens a file in GoodReader.
Switches into the Shortcuts app and continues to the next action.
Generates a MD5/SHA1 hash from the input.
Adds a data point into the Health app. You can log anything that the Health app supports, including your weight, steps taken, running distance, caloric intake and more.

Parameters.Description: The date and time of the data point. The current date will be used if you don't provide a date.
Parameters.Label: Date

Parameters.Description: The date and time for the end of the data point. The current date will be used if you don't provide a date.
Parameters.Label: End Date

Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds a workout into the Health app. You can log all kinds of activities, from running and cycling to playing a sport.

Parameters.Description: The date and time of the start of the workout
Parameters.Label: Date

Parameters.Description: The duration of the workout (optional)
Parameters.Label: Duration

Parameters.Description: The calories burned during the activity (optional)
Parameters.Label: Calories

Parameters.Description: The distance covered during the activity. Only provide this if it makes sense for the activity. (optional)
Parameters.Label: Distance

Description.DescriptionSummary: Triggers an IFTTT applet. Configure which applet in the IFTTT app.
Combines the images passed into the action horizontally, vertically, or in a grid.

Parameters.Description: When horizontal, images are connected together from left to right. When vertical, images are connected from top to bottom.
Parameters.Label: Direction

Parameters.Description: The number of pixels of transparent space to place between consecutive images.
Parameters.Label: Spacing

Description.DescriptionSummary: Converts the images passed into the action to the specified image format.

Parameters.Description: Allows you to choose the image quality used when compressing the image file. Higher quality images will look better, but result in larger files.
Parameters.Label: Quality

Parameters.Description: When Preserve Metadata is turned off, all metadata, such as the GPS coordinates where the photo was taken, will be stripped from the image file.
Parameters.Label: Preserve Metadata

Description.DescriptionSummary: Crops images to a smaller rectangle.

Parameters.Description: Where on the original image the crop should occur.
Parameters.Label: Position

Description.DescriptionSummary: Reverses the direction of images either horizontally or vertically.

Description.DescriptionInput: Images to mask
Description.DescriptionSummary: Applies a mask to each image passed into the action. For example, you can cut images into a rounded rectangle, ellipse or icon shape, or provide a custom alpha mask.

Parameters.Description: A radius to apply to each corner of the source image in pixels.
Parameters.Label: Corner Radius

Parameters.Description: An alpha mask to apply to the source image, where darker colors become transparent and lighter colors remain opaque. If the mask is sized differently than the source image, the mask is resized to match the dimensions of the source image.
Parameters.Label: Image Mask

Description.DescriptionNote: If the width or height is not set, that dimension is automatically calculated to maintain the original image's aspect ratio.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Scales images to a particular width and height.
Turns an image clockwise by a particular number of degrees.

Description.DescriptionNote: Powered by Imgur (imgur.com)
Description.DescriptionSummary: Uploads the input to Imgur.

Parameters.Description: If enabled, the action will return a link to the image, and not its Imgur page.
Parameters.Label: Direct Link

Parameters.Description: If enabled, the input images will be grouped into an album. Otherwise, the individual links will be returned.
Parameters.Label: Create Album

Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds the input to Instapaper.

Parameters.Description: This action will save your input to the specified folder. Leaving this empty will save the input to Instapaper's Home folder.
Parameters.Label: Folder

Description.DescriptionSummary: Gets the contents of a folder in Instapaper. Requires Instapaper Premium.

Parameters.Description: The folder to get bookmarks from. Leaving this empty will get items from Instapaper's Home folder.
Parameters.Label: Folder

Description.DescriptionSummary: Imports the photos passed as input into Lightroom

Description.DescriptionNote: If you specify a variable, the contents of that variable will be included in the list.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Allows you to specify a list of items to be passed to the next action.
Sets the device’s Low Power Mode to on or off.
Creates an animated GIF from the images or video passed into the action.
Makes a PDF out of the input. The resulting PDF can optionally include a quarter-inch margin for better printing.

Description.DescriptionInput: An animated GIF
Description.DescriptionSummary: Converts an animated GIF into a video.
Makes an archive out of the files passed as input. Supports creating zip, tar.gz, tar.bz2, tar, gzip, cpio, or iso archives.
Performs a number operation on the input and returns the result.
Converts the measurements passed into the action to the specified unit.
Passes the specified measurement (including number and unit) to the next action.
This action does nothing and produces no output. It is useful to separate blocks of actions, or to ensure that no input is passed to the next action.

Description.DescriptionInput: An image or video to include in the notification
Description.DescriptionSummary: Displays a local notification.
Passes a number to the next action.
Passes a random number between the given minimum and maximum to the next action. The minimum and maximum numbers are included as possible results.
Opens the specified app.
Opens the input as a file in the specified app.
Opens URLs passed into the action in Safari.

Description.DescriptionResult: When the app that's opened calls back to Shortcuts using x-success, it may include parameters in the URL. These will be passed as output to the next action, as text if there is just one parameter, or as a dictionary if there are multiple (use Get Dictionary Value to access it).
Description.DescriptionSummary: Performs the specified x-callback-url action. The x-success, x-cancel, and x-error parameters will be added automatically.

Parameters.Description: Turn this on if you want to open a callback URL that is not x-callback-url compliant and uses keys other than “x-success”, “x-error”, and “x-cancel”.
Parameters.Label: Custom Callback

Parameters.Description: If enabled, Shortcuts will use a custom success callback URL. This is useful if the app you are calling uses placeholders in the x-success URL to pass output.
Parameters.Label: Custom X-Success URL

Parameters.Description: For example, you might use shortcuts://callback?result=[[output]]
Parameters.Label: X-Success URL

Description.DescriptionInput: Background images
Description.DescriptionSummary: Overlays an image on top of another image.
Pauses the currently playing music.
Passes the specified phone numbers to the next action.
Adds the URL passed into the action to your Pinboard.
Gets bookmarks in your Pinboard account.

Parameters.Description: If specified, only items matching all of these tags will be returned. Supports a maximum of three tags.
Parameters.Label: Tags

Description.DescriptionInput: The music to be played
Description.DescriptionSummary: Plays music using the Music app.
Plays the audio file passed as input, or a default notification sound if no audio file was passed.
Adds the input to Pocket.

Parameters.Description: A comma-separated list of tags to apply to the items added to Pocket.
Parameters.Label: Tags

Description.DescriptionSummary: Returns items in your Pocket account.

Parameters.Description: If specified, only items with titles or URLs matching this search will be returned.
Parameters.Label: Search

Parameters.Description: If specified, only items matching this tag will be returned.
Parameters.Label: Tag

Description.DescriptionSummary: Displays a preview of the input.
Prints the input using AirPrint.

is.workflow.actions.properties.appstore.Name: Get Details of App Store App

Description.DescriptionNote: Powered by Diffbot (diffbot.com)
Safari Webpage items are only available when running your shortcut as an Action Extension in Safari.

Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds URLs passed into the action to your reading list.
Uses the microphone to record audio.

Parameters.Description: High-quality audio takes up a lot more space than normal audio, so stick with normal unless you really need it. Normal audio is returned as an M4A file (with AAC audio), while high-quality audio is returned in uncompressed WAV format.
Parameters.Label: Audio Quality

Description.DescriptionNote: This is a destructive and permanent action. You will be asked to confirm before events are removed.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Removes all events passed into the action from the calendars they are contained in.

Parameters.Description: When enabled, any repeats of an event in the future are also removed.
Parameters.Label: Include Future Events

Description.DescriptionNote: This is a destructive and permanent action. You will be asked to confirm before reminders are removed.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Removes all reminders passed into the action from the lists they are contained in.
Repeats the contained actions, running them the specified number of times.

Description.DescriptionInput: A list of items
Description.DescriptionResult: Every item passed to the “End Repeat” action
Description.DescriptionSummary: Takes a list of items as input, and runs the contained actions once for each item in the list.
Rounds the number(s) passed into the action.
Downloads the latest items from an RSS feed.
Extracts any RSS feed URLs from the given web URLs or webpage.
Prompts to share the input using action extensions and sharing extensions provided by other apps.

Description.DescriptionInput: Safari webpages
Description.DescriptionNote: Safari Webpage items are only available when running your shortcut as an Action Extension in Safari.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Runs JavaScript on a Safari webpage passed in as input

Parameters.Label: JavaScript

Description.DescriptionSummary: Sets a Home scene.

Parameters.Description: The home in which the scene is configured
Parameters.Label: Home

Description.DescriptionInput: The input passed to the shell script (stdin)
Description.DescriptionResult: The output from the shell script (stdout)
Description.DescriptionSummary: Runs a script on a remote computer over SSH.

Description.DescriptionInput: The input to pass to the shortcut.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Run a shortcut from your shortcut.

Description.DescriptionInput: Photos, videos, or audio to save
Description.DescriptionNote: If a photo passed as input is already in the specified album, the photo will be duplicated.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Adds the photos and videos passed as input to the specified photo album.
Scans a QR code or bar code using the camera, and returns the text/URL that is found.
Searches the App Store, returning the apps that match the specified search terms. You can get more details about the results using the Get Details of App Store App action.
Searches the iTunes Store, returning the items that match the specified search terms. You can get more details about the results using the Get Details of iTunes Product action.

Description.DescriptionInput: A location to search near.
Description.DescriptionSummary: Searches for nearby businesses.

Parameters.Description: Keywords used to search for businesses.
Parameters.Label: Search

Parameters.Description: Maximum distance in kilometers from the source location to find businesses.
Parameters.Label: Radius (km)

Description.DescriptionSummary: Opens your choice of Maps, Google Maps, or Waze and searches for the location, place, or text that was passed into the action.
Searches the web for the text provided as input.
Prompts to pick a person from your contacts and passes the selection to the next action.
Prompts to pick an email address from your contacts and passes the selection to the next action.
Prompts to pick a phone number from your contacts and passes the selection to the next action.
Prompts to choose photos and videos from your photo library.
Presents an email composer. Pass text into the action to set the email body. Other types of input are added as attachments.

Parameters.Description: The email address to send from. This must be an email address that is set up in the Mail app.
Parameters.Label: From

Description.DescriptionSummary: Sends an iMessage or SMS. Pass images, videos, or other files as input to include attachments.
Sets the device brightness.

Parameters.Description: If you set the brightness using a variable, use a number between 0 and 1 (for example, pass 0.5 for half brightness).
Parameters.Label: Brightness

Description.DescriptionSummary: Copies the result of the last action to the clipboard.

Parameters.Description: When enabled, the input will only be copied locally, and will not be shared to other devices via Handoff.
Parameters.Label: Local Only

Parameters.Description: When set, the clipboard contents will expire and be automatically deleted at the specified time. Optional.
Parameters.Label: Expire At

Description.DescriptionSummary: Sets the name of the item passed as input.

Parameters.Description: By default, Shortcuts will automatically include a file extension if one isn't specified. Turn this on if you want to create a file with no extension.
Parameters.Label: Don't Include File Extension

Description.DescriptionSummary: Sets a value in the dictionary passed into the action.
Sets the value of the specified variable to the input of this action.
Sets the system volume.

Parameters.Description: If you set the volume using a variable, use a number between 0 and 1 (for example, pass 0.5 for half volume).
Parameters.Label: Volume

Description.DescriptionSummary: Prompts to share the input.
Shows the definition of the word passed into the action.
Opens BlindSquare showing information about the place passed as input, so you can save it as a favorite, start tracking it, or start simulation mode.
Shows the date or calendar event passed as input in the Calendar app.
Shows the iTunes products or App Store apps passed as input in a store sheet. This is useful with the Search iTunes Store and Search App Store actions.
Opens the note passed in as input.
Shows the specified text in Siri or in an alert.
Shows the web URL passed into the action in a Safari View Controller, allowing you to view the webpage without switching apps.

Parameters.Description: Enter Safari Reader mode if it’s available for the given webpage.
Parameters.Label: Enter Safari Reader

Description.DescriptionSummary: Skips to the previous song in the current music queue.
Skips to the next song in the current music queue.
Posts the input to the specified Slack channel.
Speaks the inputted text aloud.
Calculates statistics on the numbers that are provided as input.
Gets photos of the locations passed as input, using Google Street View.

RequiredResources.WFUnavailableResourceReason: Shortcuts is no longer able to support Get Street View Image.

Description.DescriptionSummary: Uses the camera to take photos.
Uses the camera to take a video clip.
Changes the case of the text passed into the action to UPPERCASE, lowercase, or Title Case.
Joins text together, inserting the separator between each join.

Description.DescriptionResult: A list of text items that matched the regular expression
Description.DescriptionSummary: Searches text passed into the action for matches to a regular expression.

Parameters.Description: When disabled, the capitalization of letters is ignored.
Parameters.Label: Case Sensitive

Parameters.Description: The text to be replaced.

Description.DescriptionSummary: Separates text passed into the action into a list.

Description.DescriptionSummary: Translates the text passed into the action into another language.
Starts a timer in the Clock app for the specified amount of time.

Description.DescriptionResult: The URL of the newly created item

Parameters.Description: The name of the blog to post to
Parameters.Label: Blog

Description.DescriptionInput: Archive
Description.DescriptionSummary: Extracts files from the archive passed as input. Many archive formats are supported, including zip, rar, tar.gz, tar.bz2, tar, gzip, cpio, cab, and iso archives.
Passes the specified URL to the next action.

Description.DescriptionNote: The expanded URL is cleaned, removing unnecessary parameters such as "utm_source".
Description.DescriptionResult: The full, expanded URL, or the original URL if the URL was not shortened
Description.DescriptionSummary: This action expands and cleans up URLs which have been shortened using a URL shortening service like TinyURL or Bit.ly.
Retrieves the HTTP headers of the URL passed as input using a HEAD request.
Encodes or decodes text passed into the action to be suitable for inclusion in a URL by adding or removing percent escapes when appropriate.
Sends a payment to the specified people using a payment app on your device.
Requests a payment from the specified people using a payment app on your device.
Vibrates the device for a short amount of time.

Parameters.Description: When run on Apple Watch, the selected pattern will be tapped on to your wrist.
Parameters.Label: Haptic Pattern

Description.DescriptionSummary: Shows the results of the previous action in the Content Graph.

Pauses execution until you leave the Shortcuts app and return to it.

This action might be useful after an action that switches apps, to pause execution until you return to the Shortcuts app.
Gets the current weather conditions at the specified location.
Gets an hourly or daily weather forecast at the specified location.
Sets the device’s Wi-Fi to on or off.
